thread.title: EastEnders and Emmerdale clash tonight so which will you be watching? | Metro News
thread.title_full: EastEnders and Emmerdale clash tonight so which will you be watching? | Metro News

author: Duncan Lindsay For Metro.Co.Uk
title: EastEnders and Emmerdale clash tonight so which will you be watching? | Metro News
text:
Duncan Lindsay for Metro.co.uk Thursday 16 Feb 2017 4:13 pm (Picture: ITV/BBC) 
Soap fans are set to be divided tonight as EastEnders and Emmerdale are set to clash yet again – but for once, it’s the BBC show which will have the headstart. But which of the two soaps will you be tuning into? 
Due to an episode recently being replaced by football, EastEnders have an hour long episode tonight which picks up from where the previous episode left off. Lee Carter has done a bunk leaving Whitney alone while Michelle Fowler has been stunned by the arrival of her overseas – and much younger – boyfriend Preston. (Picture: BBC) 
The episode kicks off at 7:30pm while Emmerdale’s second episode commences from 8pm, meaning both will be airing at the same time. 
Emmerdale’s action focuses on the aftermath of the cab fire started by Emma Barton and also the Thomas family preparing for Ashley’s move into full time care. 
But where do your loyalties lie? 
Obviously, with catch up TV and online viewing, soap clashes aren’t the problem for viewers that they used to be but both soaps are bound to want the kudos of being the one that most people watched live.
